doc.after: On 5 December 1949, Israel's first Prime Minister, David Ben-Gurion, proclaimed Jerusalem as Israel's capital,[211] and since then all branches of the Israeli governmentâlegislative, judicial, and executiveâhave resided there, except for the Ministry of Defense, which is located at HaKirya in Tel Aviv.[212] At the time of the proclamation, Jerusalem was divided between Israel and Jordan and thus only West Jerusalem was proclaimed Israel's capital.
